title: US Court Rules Meta Must Face Lawsuits Over Teen Addiction To Social Media
content: Facebook parent company Meta must face lawsuits by U.S. states accusing it of encouraging social media addiction among teens, a federal judge in California ruled on Tuesday.
summary: Facebook parent company Meta must face lawsuits by U.S. states accusing it of encouraging social media addiction among teens, a federal judge in California ruled on Tuesday.

title: Trump Understands Value of Financial Institutions, Says World Bank Chief
content: World Bank President Ajay Banga on Tuesday said former President Donald Trump understands the value of international financial institutions and how their lending can lead to expanded markets for American companies overseas.
summary: World Bank President Ajay Banga on Tuesday said former President Donald Trump understands the value of international financial institutions and how their lending can lead to expanded markets for American companies overseas.

title: Trump Claims Harris Is "Dying To See My Cholesterol" In Truth Social Rant
content: Kamala Harris questioned Donald Trump's state of mind today after the 78-year-old Republican's latest televised town hall metamorphosed into a bizarre, unexpected music session.
summary: Kamala Harris questioned Donald Trump's state of mind today after the 78-year-old Republican's latest televised town hall metamorphosed into a bizarre, unexpected music session.

title: Gaza War Damage Cost Likely Now $14 Billion To $20 Billion: World Bank
content: World Bank President Ajay Banga said on Tuesday that war damage from Israeli strikes on Gaza is now probably in the $14-20 billion range, and destruction from Israel's bombing of southern Lebanon will add to that regional total.
summary: World Bank President Ajay Banga said on Tuesday that war damage from Israeli strikes on Gaza is now probably in the $14-20 billion range, and destruction from Israel's bombing of southern Lebanon will add to that regional total.

title: How Far Can Trudeau Go As Personal Electoral Gain Trumps Diplomatic Ties
content: Justin Trudeau's attempts for personal electoral gains have reached a level where actual diplomatic relations are seeing a fallout over "the politics of vote-bank". Is his government's attempts to retain power proving to be the downfall of Canada?
summary: Justin Trudeau's attempts for personal electoral gains have reached a level where actual diplomatic relations are seeing a fallout over "the politics of vote-bank". Is his government's attempts to retain power proving to be the downfall of Canada?

title: Netanyahu Opposes Ceasefire Deal That Won't Halt Hezbollah From Rearming
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday he told French President Emmanuel Macron that he would not agree to a ceasefire deal that failed to stop Hezbollah rearming and regrouping.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday he told French President Emmanuel Macron that he would not agree to a ceasefire deal that failed to stop Hezbollah rearming and regrouping.

title: US Warns Israel Of Potential Aid Cuts Over Gaza Assistance Delays
content: The United States warned Israel on the possibility of withholding some assistance barring improvements in aid delivery to Palestinians in Gaza, the State Department said Tuesday.
summary: The United States warned Israel on the possibility of withholding some assistance barring improvements in aid delivery to Palestinians in Gaza, the State Department said Tuesday.

title: India At UN Condemns Pak's "Unsubstantiated Allegations" Regarding J&K
content: India exercised its right of reply against Pakistan at the Joint General Debate on decolonization at the United Nations on Monday.
summary: India exercised its right of reply against Pakistan at the Joint General Debate on decolonization at the United Nations on Monday.

title: US Extends Restrictions For Commercial Flights Over Iraq Until 2027
content: The Federal Aviation Administration on Tuesday extended the restrictions on commercial airlines over Iraq for US flights for another three years citing risks to flights.
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration on Tuesday extended the restrictions on commercial airlines over Iraq for US flights for another three years citing risks to flights.

title: Singapore Scrambled Jets To Escort Air India Express Plane After Bomb Threat
content: Singapore Armed Forces on Tuesday scrambled two fighter jets to escort an Air India Express plane away from populated areas following a bomb threat before the aircraft landed safely at Singapore's Changi airport.
summary: Singapore Armed Forces on Tuesday scrambled two fighter jets to escort an Air India Express plane away from populated areas following a bomb threat before the aircraft landed safely at Singapore's Changi airport.

title: Decade Of No Dialogue, Then A 20-Second Greeting, India, Pak De-Hyphenated
content: S Jaishankar, who is in Pakistan for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation or SCO Summit being hosted by Islamabad, had a brief interaction with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif today at an official dinner held for all the summit attendees.
summary: S Jaishankar, who is in Pakistan for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation or SCO Summit being hosted by Islamabad, had a brief interaction with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif today at an official dinner held for all the summit attendees.

title: Jaishankar 1st Minister In Nearly A Decade To Visit Pak. What's Expected
content: S Jaishankar today landed in Islamabad to attend a conclave of the SCO, in the first visit to Pakistan by an Indian minister in nearly a decade.
summary: S Jaishankar today landed in Islamabad to attend a conclave of the SCO, in the first visit to Pakistan by an Indian minister in nearly a decade.

title: US Teacher Groomed Teen Student Before Having Sex With Him, Alleges Lawsuit
content: On his eighth-grade graduation day, Solis took the boy into a classroom, locked the door, and coerced him into sex.

title: "The Solution Is A Ceasefire": Hezbollah Deputy Chief Warns Israel
content: Hezbollah deputy chief Naim Qassem warned Israelis on Tuesday that the only solution to the current war was a ceasefire that would pave the way for north Israel residents to return, vowing his group would not be defeated.
summary: Hezbollah deputy chief Naim Qassem warned Israelis on Tuesday that the only solution to the current war was a ceasefire that would pave the way for north Israel residents to return, vowing his group would not be defeated.

title: Finance Minister's Mexico, US Visit To Focus On G20, IMF, World Bank Meets
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will embark on an official visit to Mexico and the USA to participate in the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governor (FMCBG) and fund bank annual meeting.
summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will embark on an official visit to Mexico and the USA to participate in the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governor (FMCBG) and fund bank annual meeting.

title: Most Victims Of Israeli Air Strike In Lebanon Were Women And Children: UN
content: The UN human rights office said on Tuesday it had received reports that most of the 22 victims of an Israeli air strike on a building in northern Lebanon were women and children.
summary: The UN human rights office said on Tuesday it had received reports that most of the 22 victims of an Israeli air strike on a building in northern Lebanon were women and children.

title: Kamala Harris Accused Of Plagiarism In Book About Being 'Smart On Crime'
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris is under scrutiny due to allegations of plagiarism in a book she co-authored in 2009.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris is under scrutiny due to allegations of plagiarism in a book she co-authored in 2009.

title: Maldives President Fires Over 225 Political Appointees To Cut Costs
content: The Maldives president has sacked more than 225 political appointees, including ministers, in a bid to reduce the cash-strapped Indian Ocean nation's expenditure, his office said on Tuesday.
summary: The Maldives president has sacked more than 225 political appointees, including ministers, in a bid to reduce the cash-strapped Indian Ocean nation's expenditure, his office said on Tuesday.

title: New York Times' "Cease And Desist" Notice To AI Startup Over Content Use
content: The New York Times has sent generative AI startup Perplexity a "cease and desist" notice demanding the company stop using its content, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.
summary: The New York Times has sent generative AI startup Perplexity a "cease and desist" notice demanding the company stop using its content, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.
